name: Confédération Internationale des Négociants en Oeuvres d'Art
goal:
As the International Federation of Dealer Associations, CINOA, established in 1935, is the global leader in representing the international art and antiques trade, setting benchmark standards including the world-wide adoption of The CINOA Code of Ethics. Its 30 member associations represent 20 countries and 5000 of the world’s leading dealers, with an additional 2000 booksellers via the associate membership of the International League of Antiquarian Booksellers (ILAB).

CINOA actively campaigns on major issues affecting the preservation, protection and promotion of antiquities, art and antiques, while working hard on improving standards further in the interests of best practice, transparency and cultural exchange.
euInitiatives: The EC Droit de Suite Directive, the EC Directive on collective management of copyright and related rights, Return of Cultural Goods, Reduced Rates of VAT, Consumer Rights Directive, CITES/Rhinoceros horns, the bans on Ivory, EU regulation on the import of cultural goods and other cultural heritage laws as well as anti-money laundering regulations.
